qas.question: How much of Oklahoma is covered in forests?
What types of prairie grasslands does Oklahoma have?
What part of Oklahoma has low rainfall?
What types of trees grow near rivers in western Oklahoma?

answers.text: pinyon pines, red cedar (junipers), and ponderosa pines

qas.question: What rare types of maples grow in southwest Oklahoma?

context: Forests cover <a0_0>24 percent<a0_0/> of Oklahoma and prairie grasslands composed of <a1_0>shortgrass, mixed-grass, and tallgrass prairie<a1_0/>, harbor expansive ecosystems in the state's central and western portions, although cropland has largely replaced native grasses. Where rainfall is sparse in the <a2_0>western<a2_0/> regions of the state, shortgrass prairie and shrublands are the most prominent ecosystems, though <a3_0>pinyon pines, red cedar (junipers), and ponderosa pines<a3_0/> grow near rivers and creek beds in the far western reaches of the panhandle. Southwestern Oklahoma contains many rare, disjunct species including <a4_0>sugar maple, bigtooth maple<a4_0/>, nolina and southern live oak.
